message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with information-theoretical private information retrieval (PIR) from coded databases with colluding servers. It involves the use of locally repairable codes (LRCs) with maximal recoverability (MR) and optimal global minimum distance, which are primarily studied in the information theory community (cs.IT). The paper also discusses the storage and retrieval of information from databases, which falls under the category of data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The security aspect of the PIR scheme involves collusion resistance, which is a topic in cryptography (cs.CR). The paper also involves the use of linear codes and Reed-Solomon codes, which are studied in the context of coding theory (cs.DC) and error-correcting codes (cs.CC).
